alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 2:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wayne County through 315 PM EDT... At 229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cabell, or 14 miles west of Monticello, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cabell around 240 PM EDT. Parnell and Zula around 245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Susie, Monticello, Cooper, Steubenville and Oil Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
